page.title: 14Rochford Church
page.content: There are many places of worship in the Rochford area of all types and denominations; Baptist, Methodist, Spiritualist, Roman Catholic, Church of England, Evangelical etc. The largest of these is the C of E Church in Rochford, the Parish Church of St. Andrew. It was mainly built in the 15th century. Its most outstanding feature in its red brick tower, built by Thomas Boteler, Earl of Ormond. The Tower of Rochford church in the past has secreted illicit spirits, tea and cloth brought from France via the River Roche. In a cavity below the pulpit, it is said, the smugglers' ammunition was stored! The East window is of early perpendicular work of five lights, the head filled with mullioned tracery. The church has a full peal of bells. The names on the graves in the yard are yet known in Rochford today.
